summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG agents with a Federal Bureau of Prisons employee (Correctional Systems Officer) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 5, 2021. The interview is part of the OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances, focusing on inmate movement documentation, court/call-out lists, and count procedures at MCC around August 2019.

events.title: Transfer of Efrain Reyes
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes was transferred from MCC to a GEO private prison based on U.S. Marshal Service emails. He was listed as 'pre-removed' at 0838 hours on the daily log, indicating he was leaving MCC for good.

events.title: Movement of Nicholas Tartaglione
events.description: Inmate Nicholas Tartaglione was moved from the SHU to 9 North and placed on a dry cell around 3:00 p.m. after a contraband incident during a visit. The system update for his move was not done immediately.

events.title: OIG Interview at MCC
events.description: DOJ OIG agents conducted a voluntary interview with a BOP Correctional Systems Officer at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Count Discrepancy
events.description: A count sheet from 12:35 a.m. showed a discrepancy: the electronic list indicated 72 inmates, but the signed count slip indicated 73. Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were involved in the count.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
GEO (private prison facility referenced for inmate transfers)
keyFacts: The interview is part of the official DOJ OIG investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances at MCC.

The BOP employee witness explains that inmate call-out lists (not court lists) are created in the Sentry system, printed, and disseminated, but are typically deleted and recreated daily, making them difficult to obtain after the fact.
Emails from the U.S. Marshal Service show inmate Efrain Reyes was scheduled for transfer from MCC to a GEO facility on August 9, 2019, explaining his 'pre-removed' status on logs.

Protocol dictates that when an inmate is physically moved from one housing unit to another (e.g., SHU to 9 North), control center should be notified immediately to update the system, ensuring accurate counts.
The BOP uses a chit (C-H-I-T) system for equipment/key accountability, not a sign-out system. Each officer has personalized chits they exchange for equipment.
